intro: Arabis repanda, commonly known as the broadleaf candytuft, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a low-growing perennial that produces clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. The plant has basal leaves that are broadly oval and covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its early spring blooming habit.
